## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
flights_base <- read.csv(unz("./flights.csv.zip", "flights.csv"))
head(flights_base)

#O código demorou 1 minuto e 20 segundos para carregar
```

```{r}
library(readr)

flights_readr <- read_csv(unz("./flights.csv.zip", "flights.csv"))
head(flights_readr)

#O código demorou 30 segundos para carregar
```

```{r}
library(reticulate)
py_install("pandas")
```

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import zipfile

with zipfile.ZipFile("./flights.csv.zip") as z:
    with z.open("flights.csv") as f:
        flights = pd.read_csv(f)
print(flights.head())

#O código demorou 29 segundos para carregar
```
